solution_line_template: Bess throws the Frisbee out {bess_throws_count} times * {bess_throw_distance} meters each time = <<{bess_throws_count}*{bess_throw_distance}={bess_out_distance}>>{bess_out_distance} meters.

She then throws it back which doubles the distance traveled to {bess_out_distance} meters * {double_factor} = <<{bess_out_distance}*{double_factor}={bess_total_distance}>>{bess_total_distance} meters.
Holly throws the Frisbee out {holly_throws_count} times * {holly_throw_distance} meters = <<{holly_throws_count}*{holly_throw_distance}={holly_total_distance}>>{holly_total_distance} meters.

So in total, Holly and Bess have thrown the Frisbees {bess_total_distance} + {holly_total_distance} = <<{bess_total_distance}+{holly_total_distance}={total_distance_traveled}>>{total_distance_traveled} meters.
